title: Experience

text:
Kami menginap di Aloft Seminyak pd bulan April 2022. Kami mendapatkan kamar di lantai dasar yg langsung connecting ke pool. 

Kamar yg nyaman, tempat tidur yg nyaman, kamar mandi yg nyaman. 

Hanya saja di area teras kamar tidak diperbolehkan merokok. Jd apabila ingin merokok harus keluar di lobby dulu. 

Breakfast ada di lantai A. 
Lantai paling atas menghadap ke kolam renang yg kita bisa langsung liat lautan. 
Indah sekali apabila tidak hujan.

Varian breakfast harus lebih ditambah, kami rasa dengan harga kamar segitu bisa lah vairan bfast nya seperti element ubud yg di mana satu brand dengan Aloft. 
Kopi nya kurang nendang yaa..
Bisa cari beans lain kok. 
Banyak pasti di Bali.

AC di dalam lift juga sebaikanya di nyalakan.
AC di hallway pd saat mau masuk kamar juga sebaiknya di nyalakan. 

Aloft terletak di daerah batu belig. 
500 meter dr pantai, dan bertetangga dengan Mari Beach club dan Cafe Del Mar. 
apabila membutuhkan tes antigen dan pcr ada persis di belakang hotel. 

Mau cari makanan gampang, 
Toko serba ada tinggal ke sebrang hotel. 

Terima kasih banyak untuk seluruh team dan staff di Aloft Seminyak Bali.

Karena agak kesel,anak saya mengganti pesanan soto betawi menjadi omellette sosis krn kita berpikir pesanan omeleete simple dan tidak memakan waktu lama.Tapi apa yang terjadi?? text:
Stay disini total 4 malam. Waaw experience overall. Lokasi dekat dengan canggu dan beach club, staff super, kebersihan bintang 5. Sejujurnya dengan harga segini ga berharap banyak tapi turn out dengan perasaan yang luar biasa happy tinggal disini.
1.kamar kecil tapi bagus. Mengusung konsep art deco dan friendly hotel. Kamar super bersih, cukup socket, kasur dan bantal enak.
2. Sarapan cukup bervariasi dan enak untuk ukuran harga hotel. Sarapan di chapel kecil yang menghadap ke laut. Memberikan rasa chill dan nyaman. Terimakasih pak Andara dari Fb department. Oh ya hari terakhir kami ga bisa breakfast karena flight kami di pagi hari. Kami disiapkan take away breakfast meskipun hanya croissant dan danish tapi luar biasa service nya.
3.  Staff are amazinggg really. Ibu femmy, pak pram, pak thio semuaa super friendly. Satu hari saya butuh motor untuk ke jimbaran karena jauh dan seminyak macet, telp telp rental motor dan nihil, saya dateng ke reception dengan putus asa dan pinjem motor, ibu femmy dengan sigap mencarikan saya rental motor dengan harga yang murah banget. Terimakasih banyaj

Overall, saya ga berharap banyak sebenernya pas check in disini, tapi justru saya mendapatkan pengalaman yang luar biasa happy dibanding stay di hotel mewah beberapa hari sebelumnya yang harganya hampir 6x lebih.
Thank you aloft seminyak

text:
My fav hotel selama jalan-jalan di Seminyak. Dari depan keliatan biasa aja, eitsss pas masuk ternyata keren banget. Jadi ini tuh hotel urban yang konsepnya industrial gitu. Lobbynya aja kece, check in nya udah touchless dan welcome drinkmya seger banget. Masih di lobby, ada grab & go buat yang suka laper tengah malem, ada meja billiard juga, ada internet cornernya juga. Staffnya superrrrb ramahnya.

Kamarnya yawlaaa kece bangett sumpah ini, desainnya sama layoutnya bikin cakep, betah dan nyaman banget buat liburan di Bali. Apalagi lokasinya deket pantai Seminyak, tinggal jalan kali doank. Fasilitas kamarnya juga lengkap kap, amenities bisa minta ya kalo butuh.

Nah nah, pool nya beach view loh. Udah gitu pool barnya juga enak banget di rooftop gitu sambil liat pantai dari jauh. Yang nggak kalah estetik, restorannya "Kaluna" yang instagramable banget, cantik dan cozy banget buat chill out. Makanannya juga juara bangetttt pas sarapan, ala cartenya apalagi enak banget sumpah

Overall staycation di Aloft Bali Seminyak ini bener2 experience yang menyenangkan bangett, betah dan pengen balik lagi tentunya.

text:
We stayed at the Aloft Seminyak for 3 nights at the end of February. 

Firstly the staff are lovely, always happy to help and the hotel is in a good location, with very modern and spacious rooms. Food is also very good, great breakfast and lots of choice. Nothing to fault in the overall stay which is why I gave it 5 stars.

There were a few niggly points however at the end of the stay which did frustrate slightly. Firstly, they gave us 300,000 IDR as part of the package that we booked. When we checked in we were given these and it was not stated to us that these were in fact one voucher for each day. This was rather frustrating as when we tried to use the vouchers on the last day to offer our food bill after checking out, they told us we could only use one. Not a lot of money, but still rather annoying we weren't told this on arrival.

Secondly, on checkout the initial charge on my card which was taken on arrival, I thought would just offset the bill or be returned to my card that day. However I was told that I would have to pay the full bill again, and the initial charge (about 5 million IDR) would take around 2 weeks to be refunded back onto my card. Again, this was very frustrating and should be relayed to guests on paying. This is not the norm in bali (I have stayed elsewhere where this does not happen) and was rather frustrating as two weeks later, I still haven't received the money back onto my card. 

Despite these two points, I have given it 5 stars as I couldn't fault the actual hotel, staff and overall service.
title: Great hotel, few small points to improve

text:
We arrived in Bali, took a WIRASANA taxi before you exit the airport ($24.00)  and were greeted like dignitaries upon arrival.  Emon grabbed our bags and placed them by the front desk.  I thought he had a twin because he was back in a flash with free cool refreshing drinks and a gracious smile.  Femi, found our reservations and explained everything to a tee.  We then wanted our rooms charged with separate cards and Tione (a highly intelligent manager) informed Femi how to do it swiftly and answered my questions.  Our rooms were not available because it was 1100.  Tionie informed us that it would be an honor to store our 3 bags (an honor, wow).  Emon grabbed them quickly and gave us a claim ticket, can you say whew!

We were hungry so we ate in the hotel and can you say OH MY GOD!  The signature oxtail with fried rice and pickles were amazing as well as the variety of fresh fruit drinks and detox drinks!  Although we savored the oxtails, the breakfast smorgasbord buffet was even better!!!  I hate booking breakfast with hotels because they usually are so lame.  But I'm glad my friend did this time. We had some coffee, fresh fruit, fresh juice, made to order omelets, and a broccoli chicken concoction that was simply delicious.  My friend loved her rice soup, noodles, sausages, and fish sticks too.  We ate so good and full we generally skipped lunch. The staff in the restaurant must have thought we were royals because they were ever so gracious, fast, and courteous.  Thank you Astuti, Putra (an expert on local customs and culture) and Monica, you guys are the best!

Then Kristanti, a beautiful, highly astute professional General Manager provided a list of must see attractions (after she inquired about our stay) and we told her our ideas.  She gets an A++++ for her suggestions.  Furthermore, a taxi driver that my friend hired (we should have taken Kristanti's reasonable taxi recommendation) didn't know where to go so we called her at 620pm and she answered the phone and provided prompt instructions.  Our taxi driver steered us to some lame fire dance that had 70 year old men dancing (the previous day).  They danced the hell out of their fingers, lol.  

THE IMMACULATE ROOMS - the beds were so comfortable I had lines on my face and arms when I woke up and the showers are award winning!  There are two...one normal detachable and a rain water head. Incidentally, the shower can hold 4 people and the toilet has a bidet.  The lighting, open roominess, self controlled air, safe, and plush towels have assured me a future stay.  I don't know our maid's name but she deserves a raise!  Her gentle touches were noticed. And by the way, a money exchange (great rates), mini store, restaurants, Bening Massage are across the street and Seminyak beach is a 5 minute walk.  GREAAAAAT location! 

Thank you Kristanti, you are an AMAZING General Manager and your team is freaking awesome!  We were ever so delighted to stay at Aloft. You and your staff definitely created fond memories for all four of us.  My humble words and simple gratitude do not do you and your staff justice, thank you again.
title: Phenomenal Hotel, Superb Staff, and Great Location!

text:
The Aloft Seminyak is beautifully appointed, but the stand out for us was the friendly and attentive staff. The ladies on the front desk always greeted us warmly and went out of their way to ensure that we were having a good stay. The breakfast is great with a la carte options, along with a self-serve buffet - we loved that you could have your eggs cooked fresh, however you like it, and the freshly made waffles or pancakes. Shout out to Ben in the kitchen, who was undoubtably one of the friendliest chefs that we've met throughout our travels!

The rooftop infinity pool was a great place to relax and soak up some rays. There are a handful of beach clubs within walking distance for those that want to party the day away. Don't be fooled by google maps - you can just walk down to the beach and then follow the beach road to a huge range of cheap restaurants (for sunset drinks/meals) and not-so-cheap beach clubs, if you prefer things a little more fancy. Following this route is also a nice shortcut to Seminyak Square!
title: Outstanding staff!

The property is a lovely boutique spot at a great location - the beach is just two minutes away, while you’re near both Seminyak and Canggu. The front desk staff are extremely helpful, and spent some time trying to figure out a booking nuance of mine which I appreciated a lot.

The rooms are well appointed and have everything you need for a short stay. My room was on the ground floor so was a bit noisy, so I would suggest you ask for a room at the back. Housekeeping are great and very diligent, my room was spotless everyday.

The restaurant at the rooftop is great, and has a good selection of local and international dishes. Everything is cooked fresh and is very tasty. 

Overall, a great spot. I’ve already rebooked it for my next trip!

text: The Aloft has a number of good qualities - close to the beach and sunset warungs, an IDR13,000 Grab bike ride to Canggu, and only a 20ish minute walk down the beach to Potato Head etc. The property has been well maintained throughout Covid, including cleanliness. Reception team friendly and helpful. Nice touches include the filtered drinking water dispenser on each floor, selection of bathroom amenities, and no mucking around with making WiFi passwords work across devices. The f&b are pricey, as you'd expect from a Marriott, but the warungs on the beach just 5 minutes away would be pleased to see you for meals and drinks. The only improvements I'd recommend are additional sunshine lounge chair seating options (remove some of the table and chairs down the side, there isn't much restaurant traffic to warrant all those empty places) and to turn the pool temperature up 2-3 degrees. I watched 4 females walk to the pool, put a toe in, then return promptly to their chairs. Haha, I was #5. No sense in having a pool that's cold. But would happily stay again. Ask for a room at the back, the garden view is interesting.

text:
Checked at 9:30pm, and was placed in a ground-floor room (111 - it has an adjoining door to room 115), as soon as we walked in we could hear and feel the thud of EDM, in speaking with the reception they said it was from the DJ up by the pool on the 4th floor of the hotel and it would stop by 11 pm. That put a stop to the early night we had wanted as we had an early tour booked and we went to the pool bar/restaurant to discover the DJ was playing to 1 person at the bar and you could not hear yourself think so it is no wonder you could feel it 4 floors below. 

After a short but reasonable sleep, we went for breakfast which for the price I think is good and the staff is attentive and helpful.

Fast forward to my last night (5 in total) and I am woken by the people in room 115 at 2am having a party in their room, so I went to call reception, the phone did not work, so I got dressed and went to reception and asked for assistance, they asked them to quieten down however 10 min later the same happened again, I returned to reception and again they tried to quieten the neighbours but again they restarted. After that between 3:50 am and 5 am no staff was available (no one in reception) to assist to swap rooms. I was kept awake for 4 hours  & ruined my last day in Bali.

I complained to reception when the morning shift started at 8 am, and their response was it's not their fault, after 2 hours and may offer they agreed to refund my last night's accommodation.
title: Noisy hotel rooms and staff not prepared to deal with issues

text: For those less familiar, Aloft Hotels were created by Starwood, the former owner of W Hotels, as a four star companion to the five star luxury W brand. This Aloft in Seminyak lives up to that standard very well. Spacious rooms, with beds and linens as comfortable as the W, modern decor and lively common areas in reception and the roof top. Where you stay at the W to stay at the W and not venture out, you stay at the Aloft because you won’t be staying at the Aloft and will be heading out and that’s my advice for this hotel. It’s close to many of the best restaurants and cafes of Bali located along Jl Batu Belig (the street the hotel is on) and is a short 10 mins walk to many popular destinations, like Cafe del Mar, Desa Potato Head, the new Mari Beach club, and of course, W Bali Seminyak where you can go to Woobar and the hotel restaurants and use the pool and other facilities like any other guest but without the price tag. While others comment on the traffic being a nightmare, that is because Jl Batu Belig is the main road between Seminyak and Canggu and it will have a lot of people going to and from at around sunset and after dark. This will cause a lot of noise for the front rooms (I stayed in a ground floor king room without pool access and it was quiet). If you do stay at the hotel, the roof top pool is small but does offer amazing views of the ocean, sunset and across the southern peninsula of the island. The gym is basically equiped and not really worth having. My only complaint with the room was that the size of the wardrobe is very same especially if there is more than 1 guest in the room. As mentioned by others the staff are uber friendly, happy to greet every guest and clearly like working at the hotel. The price is reasonable, but not a bargain, but it beats paying the price of fancier hotels especially if you’ll be out and about in trendy Seminyak and Canggu (I wouldn’t venture further than those areas because of the world famous Bali traffic. Move hotels instead and save your sanity and backside). I would stay here again happily when in the area and highly recommend especially for those looking to make use of the world class beach clubs and restaurants nearby.
title: Living the champagne lifestyle in Bali on a lemonade budget

text:
We just got to Bali and this hotel has exceeded my expectations tremendously.  The facilities are great for me and my family, two kids 10 and 8.  To say that the staff here are friendly and helpful is an understatement.   I’ve traveled all my life for work and pleasure and I have never stayed at a hotel where the entire staff from top to bottom were so kind and attentive.  It isn’t the kind of attentive where they expect to be compensated.  It is just a genuine care that I’ve never experienced anywhere else.  This place deserves all the top reviews and kind words and I am genuinely disappointed in myself that I only stayed here for two night!

Also the bedding here was OUTSTANDING!  The pillows were so good we considered buying a set and sending them home and the bed sheets were so soft and comfortable.  

The location is great for dining as well.  

I would stay here again in a heartbeat and honestly this would one of my first choices next time I’m in Bali. 

Amazing staff, great value, comfortable bedding and central location in Seminyak.

text:
Nice little hotel in Seminyak.  Excellent location with a high-end wine and liquor store close by, a mini-mart across the street, and several lively restaurant and bars which are a 2 minute walk down the road.  

The rooms are exceptionally clean and brand new looking… excellent maintenance through COVID.  The front desk staff is delightful… very friendly, young, efficient, knowledgeable, and helpful.  All of them, without exception, especially the Rockstar Edgar.  There is a rooftop restaurant and infinity pool and the view is wonderful from atop.  Breakfast spread is very generous and comprehensive and the breakfast wait staff and chef are extremely hard working and service oriented.  Excellent value for money at about USD $65 for our last night in Bali where we based ourselves out of Seminyak.  

They upgraded us to one of the 8 rooms on the first floor which have direct access from the balcony sitout into the swimming pool.  This place is not a luxury hotel like some of the fancy expensive ones in Bali, but it is perfect for anyone on a budget that wants cleanliness, spotlessly new look and feel, homely feel, good location, and 7* service levels.  

While you stay here, do not forget to hang out for an evening at Red Carpet, Kudeta, and at Potato Head (at Potato, avoid their bespectacled manager Dui… he is by far the rudest and most obnoxious person we met in all of Bali… true sore thumb of Bali).  Also do go shopping to Seminyak Village and Kayu Aya Market, and clubbing to Shishi and La Favela.  

Enjoy Seminyak and Aloft!!
title: Simple, Pure, and Elegant

text:
We stayed at Aloft Bali Seminyak for three nights during our trip to Bali. The hotel is adequately located within the border of Canggu-Seminyak area and its proximity to nearby Batu Belig beach is a plus. Aloft Seminyak is pretty conveniently located in general as another consideration for our family to book a hotel is the amount of nearby warung/restaurants to grab our dinner (either via food delivery services or not).

The check-in process was pretty smooth and the front desk staffs are helpful and welcoming. They also offered me a mobile key, although it didn't work completely for the later days (perhaps it's also my phone's problem as I occurred the same issue on another Marriott hotel). With a youthful and vibrant ambiance, I can tell that this hotel is marketed towards a more younger age group with the music playing in the lobby and hallway too. There's a pretty tight swimming pool and gym at the rooftop (although there was no one when I went there so it's not really a problem).

We booked two rooms at this hotel: the king and twin guest rooms. I expected a tight feeling with the 28 sqm information prior to booking the hotel but I was wrong, the room is pretty spacious (and very clean) as we're still able to move around with two suitcases open in each of our rooms. The king guest room also had a sofa which is convenient. The amenities and room features are competitively complete for a 4 star hotel: a very comfortable bedding, a huge TV, a bluetooth speaker, a great amount of lighting, four pillows in each room, a comfortable working desk, iron, and many more. I would like to note for the second and third floor rooms in this hotel doesn't have a balcony so you might want to hang your wet clothes in the bathroom. Additionally, the twin sized bed is huge with a 130cm width.  

As an Indonesian myself, I am always delighted if any hotel could provide a "guling" and  Aloft is one of them. Another great point of this hotel is that they stored a water dispenser in the hallway hence it made our stay more seamless as we didn't need to buy water from mini markets when we're in the hotel. They also provided some other amenities that are available on request only such as shaving kit, sewing kit, cutleries plates and bowls, plus muslim prayer kit (although they didn't have a sarung and the stock is very limited). 

I didn't really encounter much trouble with the service as the most of them are helpful (housekeeping, front desk staffs, etc) except for the breakfast service. Don't get me wrong, all of the meals actually had great taste but the service is the problem. For the breakfasts we had, on the first day we decided to had our meal to go as we had to leave early for Nusa Penida. I appreciate that they did offer early breakfast box service although the selection was limited: Nasi Goreng, Sandwich, or Pastries (all three with some selection of juices). 

The main trouble occurred on the second day, we decided to eat at the restaurant and (1) we didn't know that the breakfast will be served in a-la carte and not buffet, which is a pity as even many other 3 star hotels provided one. (Even the same group, 4-star Fairfield Kuta and Legian offered buffet). When I arrived the waitress said that we might "criss-cross" the menu if we would like and I decided to give it a go. (2) She wrote the orders on paper which is a pretty traditional approach that might result another trouble later on. (3) The food and drinks came out one by one with a great time gap in between. It's not really a problem if you don't have anything to do for the day but it is a problem when you have plans and had to leave on time. In between those times, my sister's order was not made for more than 30 minutes and the waitress said that (4) the paper flew from the ordering list. This is not a problem that we would like to know as a costumer, what we would like to know is how much longer till the food will be served. Once we finished, we just left and my mother complained about the experience.

Once we arrived back with the hotel, we were greeted by the person in charge, Enggal and so we told about our experience. We both agreed that the staffs at Kahuna need more training as the hotel is relatively very new (opened in 2019). Regarding the issue, he offered us a sweet treat of klepon-flavored cake and a letter of forgiveness and he would guarantee a better experience on the next day.

Traumatized, we decided to have our food delivered to our room on the third day. We ordered the night before with the menu displayed on the TV channel's QR code. However, there's another trouble as the TV menu is apparently outdated by a week yet we have decided on our options. I called the restaurant and they handed me a new menu. But as the manager has promised before that he guaranteed a better experience, we were able to book the TV-based menu. I still questioned myself had we not encountered "the" trouble from the day before, would we still be able to book the outdated menu? That's another question of the day.

On the third day, the breakfast was delivered to our room (5 mins late, tolerable) and it was definitely a way better experience than the day before. Regarding the taste, they are all delicious. I would like to point out the tasty french toast, rendang benedict, and the yogurt. They all had an exquisite taste. We also had unique drinks that tasted very refreshing. 

All in al, staying at Aloft Bali Seminyak was pretty comfortable except for the key points that I have pointed out. If I were to return to the hotel, I hope that they are elevating the breakfast experience to be more convenient.
title: A comfortable stay, except for the breakfast service

text:
We went here for Nyepi Day staycation. Aloft is a new lifestyle hotel in strategic location at Seminyak. First impression, the hotel has a basement for car park which is good for us. Came to Lobby the ambience was so vibrant. The wall is full with beautiful mural for beautiful photo captured. They also have billiard in the lobby. 

We got upgraded to pool access room which is amazing. By the time you open the glass door, you can see the pool and swim ! I love the uniqueness of another mural creation on our bathroom. Its beautifully painted in our mirror as welcome greetings in line with some colourful balloon set up on our bed. 

The fact that they have 2 swimming pools are fantastic! so we can choose where to swim either using the pool in front of our room or a beautiful sky pool on rooftop facing their iconic Kahuna restaurant. 

The service of the staff was great. They are so humble and helping. Thanks to Febri, the housekeeping staff who did a great job in making our room. Firman in kitchen did a very nice work in cooking our food during Nyepi. Love the smoke house very much. The mushroom beef was amazing. Thank you as well to Yoga, Keiko and Andara for the great service during our Nyepi staycation. 

Overall, the service, quality and facility at ALoft Seminyak were great. I mean with that affordable price, you can experience all this lifestyle hotel in Seminyak. Will come back again. Very recommended !
title: A New Lifestyle Hotel with great service and facilities

text:
I’m not even sure where to start this review because everything was done brilliantly!

We had a two night stay which we booked last minute due to some changes in our schedule.  The hotel had just opened days before our stay which was a little concerning but we decided to stay anyway and we didn’t regret it for one second from the moment we walked in.

There is a scanning machine on the way into the hotel but it’s super fast and it’s there for guest and staff safety.

Check-in was a breeze and staff were super cheerful and went way above and beyond.  The hotel manager introduced himself to us and was extremely friendly.

Upon entering our room we were greeted by several personal messages (enjoy your family vacation, thank you for being a platinum elite member etc), a snack and a bed full of balloons which our child LOVED!  It definitely kept him entertained.  The bathroom was gorgeously finished and the room was very comfortable.  Lots of neat touches with a pretty young vibe.  

We checked out the pool and restaurant and that didn’t disappoint either.  The pool is brightly coloured, has great seating, looks over amazing sunsets, and the pool service was excellent as well.

The restaurant...  I’m not even sure how to explain how impressive it was!  The manager that was here training the new staff (from a sister hotel) was amazing.  We had a number of great chats and he was absolutely phenomenal with our son.  The chef would come out daily and check in on us and ask our son what he wanted to eat.  He would literally get him whatever he wanted and would bring out special items just for him.  Our son just wanted to stay in the restaurant and be spoiled from the staff.  He really, really loved it there.  For us, the food was great.  It was always fresh, there was a lot of options to choose from at breakfast, staff were amazing all around.  The menu items for lunch and dinner were great as well and everything was reasonably priced.  I couldn’t have asked for anything better.  

The hotel is conveniently located and is a little bit on the outside of the crowded areas of Seminyak but still very close to the ocean and small shops that line the street.

We were sad to leave such a great hotel.  The hotel itself was very nice but the staff made it amazing!  I honestly couldn’t have asked for better service or a better stay.  We stay at a lot of hotels and travel frequently and this was by far the best staff I’ve ever had the pleasure to meet.  I wish we could go back but we live in Northern Ontario and it’s a very far trek to get there.
title: One of the most memorable stays

text:
I stayed at Aloft Bali Seminyak last Saturday, a hotel at the most strategic point. Close to Seminyak, Canggu, Denpasar, near all the places I love!

They equip the hotel with x-ray checks for goods and bodies, as you typically encounter at the airport—which is cool! This hotel ensures that everything is secure. When you step inside, a mixture of colors polished throughout the room will greet you, furnished with unique furniture. There are also billiard, bar and re:fuel (a 24-hour self-service mini-market). The check-in process is also very convenient and quick, the staff are very fun and friendly! You can invite them to play billiards together!

When I arrived on the 3rd floor where my room was, a wall made of wooden speakers greeted me along with the room numbers that were made like hanging balls and the corridor was full of impressive music! It’s marvelous.

When I stepped into the room, they prepared me a surprise! Balloons were showered on my bed, then sweet notes from the General Manager, equipped with pink ukuleles, microphones and unicorn dolls! I could not resist this cuteness, as well as sweet dishes on the desk in the room’s corner.

HIGHLIGHT POINT: They will draw the mirror in your bathroom with some famous locations around their hotel!

Staying here is pleasant, everything feels so perfect with no shortcomings that I can point out. If you miss this when you travel to Bali, I'm sure you will be so sorry!
title: What's better than an "amazing" word?

owner_response.text:
Hey Sasha Gautama,

Thanks so much for choosing Aloft Bali Seminyak as your staycation gateway. We appreciated how you mentioned our strategic location, our lovely unique interior and equally fantastic experience at our rooftop restaurant Kahuna. 
Hope we can see you back again soon for another amazing stay.

Stay Savvy, 

Kristanti Tannady 
General Manager 
Aloft Bali Seminyak

photos.caption: The surprise they prepared on my bed.

text:
I've been living at Aloft hotel for 3 weeks now and this is the best hotel in all of Bali (I've stayed at the Ritz Carlton and Stones Hotel). I'm also a Marriott Titanium Elite member (I've spent over 300 nights in Marriott hotels the last 2 years for work), and I'm comfortable saying that this is my favorite hotel in the world. You will feel like home when you're here.
Here's why I love this place:
1) The staff is AMAZING! They are so friendly and full of smiles, laughter, and just absolutley wonderful people. I've even been able to learn to speak some Indonesian through my conversations with the wonderful team at Aloft.
2) The location is perfect! You are right on the water, close to beachfront restaurants/clubs, and there are some cool shops nearby where you can have custom clothes made.
3) The Breakfast is incredible. The dining team is so friendly and accommodating to whatever you could possibly want to eat and the food that the dining team cooks is the best food I've ever had.
4) The infinity rooftop pool is awesome. Perfect for sunbathing and has an awesome view of the ocean.
I've enjoyed my stay so much that once I return from Ubud, I will be spending another 2 months at Aloft. Thank you to everyone who works at the hotel. You've made my business partner and I feel at home on the other side of the world.
TERIMA KASI!
Michael White and Eli Wallace
title: Best Hotel Ever
